remarks: Conversely, a nonzero coefficient sets a lower bound on the degree. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Mar-2015.)
statement:
deg1leb.d $e |- D = ( deg1 ` R ) $.
deg1leb.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
deg1leb.b $e |- B = ( Base ` P ) $.
deg1leb.y $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
deg1leb.a $e |- A = ( coe1 ` F ) $.
deg1ge $p |- ( ( F e. B /\ G e. NN0 /\ ( A ` G ) =/= .0. ) -> G <_ ( D ` F ) ) $.
